title: The Launch: Fashion News to Know This December
description: Here’s what to shop ahead of the holidays.
excerpt: Plus, more fashion news to know this month.
text: It’s officially the holiday season, which means cold temperatures, cozy knitwear, and putting together your wish list. Before you head out to do all your festive shopping, check out the must-know fashion launches to indulge in some much-needed retail therapy. Below, here’s what you need to know this month, from Michael Kors’s newest store opening to Bottega Veneta’s artisanal showcase.Courtesy of Michael KorsWho: Michael Kors What: Store openingWhere: 667 Madison Avenue, New York CityWhy: Michael Kors has opened his newest store on Madison Avenue, marking the first boutique on the East Coast dedicated solely to the designer’s eponymous collection pieces. The interior of the sprawling, 2,800-square-foot space is true to the brand, evoking a minimalist luxury while displaying Kors’ newest pieces for the season. The collection includes pieces from six local artisans based in Venice, as a tribute to the brand’s roots. The pieces vary from hand-blown glasswork to sculptural wooden jigsaw puzzles. While they’re available to shop via the brands’ own websites, check out our current favorite Bottega picks below.Bottega Veneta Knot Ankle BootCredit: Courtesy of Bottega VenetaBottega Veneta Small AndiamoCredit: Courtesy of Bottega VenetaBottega Veneta Knot Hoop EarringsCredit: Courtesy of Bottega VenetaJimmy Choo Unveils New Flagship on Madison Avenue COURTESY OF JIMMY CHOOWho: Jimmy ChooWhat: Flagship openingWhere: 667 Madison Avenue, New York CityWhy: Jimmy Choo is moving on up to the Upper East Side with its newest flagship opening. The boutique’s interior, designed by Nebihe Cihan, was inspired by the idea of stepping into a jewelry box. Mission accomplished: The space feels soft and neutral with textured walls and curved edges, allowing the footwear to stand out.Jimmy Choo Scarlett 50Credit: Courtesy of Jimmy ChooJimmy Choo Cinch MCredit: Courtesy of Jimmy ChooJimmy Choo Diamond Chain EarringCredit: Courtesy of Jimmy ChooThe North Face and Skims Partner on New CapsuleCourtesy of SKIMSWho: The North Face and SkimsWhat: Capsule collectionWhere: Online at skims.com starting December 10Why: With ski season rapidly approaching, The North Face has teamed up with Skims on a new capsule collection. The pieces combine the outerwear giant’s archival styles with Skims’s signature fit and pared-back color palette. The pieces vary from ski jackets to tops and bodysuits.Vera Wang Designs High Jewelry Collection for Jared AtelierCourtesy of Jared JewelersWho: Vera Wang and Jared AtelierWhat: High jewelry collectionWhere: Online at jared.comWhy: Jared has tapped none other than Vera Wang to design the third installment of Jared Atelier, the jewelry brand’s limited-edition collection. The assortment is comprised of 14 one-of-a-kind high jewelry pieces featuring natural diamonds and rubies. Ranging from $12,500 to $125,000, Wang’s chosen motifs included serpents, ribbons, and diamond strings, all inspired by nature, architecture, and modern design.Jared Atelier x Vera Wang Ribbons Motif Diamond Cuff BraceletJared Atelier x Vera Wang Diamond Strings Motif Diamond Drape NecklaceJared Atelier x Vera Wang Serpents Motif Natural Ruby & Diamond Brooch
html:
It’s officially the holiday season, which means cold temperatures, cozy knitwear, and putting together your wish list. Before you head out to do all your festive shopping, check out the must-know fashion launches to indulge in some much-needed retail therapy. Below, here’s what you need to know this month, from Michael Kors’s newest store opening to Bottega Veneta’s artisanal showcase.

Who: Michael Kors

What: Store opening

Where: 667 Madison Avenue, New York City

Why: Michael Kors has opened his newest store on Madison Avenue, marking the first boutique on the East Coast dedicated solely to the designer’s eponymous collection pieces. The interior of the sprawling, 2,800-square-foot space is true to the brand, evoking a minimalist luxury while displaying Kors’ newest pieces for the season.

Michael Kors Collection Sleeveless Cashmere Turtleneck

Michael Kors Collection Long Sequined Fishtail Skirt

Michael Kors Collection Gwyneth Frame Leather Top-Handle Bag

Bottega Veneta Debuts Bottega for Bottegas

Who: Bottega Veneta

What: Bottega for Bottegas, a seasonal showcase of artisanal craft

Where: Online at bottegaveneta.com

Why: Just in time for the holidays, Bottega Veneta has released its annual seasonal showcase, Bottega for Bottegas. The collection includes pieces from six local artisans based in Venice, as a tribute to the brand’s roots. The pieces vary from hand-blown glasswork to sculptural wooden jigsaw puzzles. While they’re available to shop via the brands’ own websites, check out our current favorite Bottega picks below.

Bottega Veneta Knot Ankle Boot

Bottega Veneta Small Andiamo

Bottega Veneta Knot Hoop Earrings

Jimmy Choo Unveils New Flagship on Madison Avenue

Who: Jimmy Choo

What: Flagship opening

Where: 667 Madison Avenue, New York City

Why: Jimmy Choo is moving on up to the Upper East Side with its newest flagship opening. The boutique’s interior, designed by Nebihe Cihan, was inspired by the idea of stepping into a jewelry box. Mission accomplished: The space feels soft and neutral with textured walls and curved edges, allowing the footwear to stand out.

Jimmy Choo Scarlett 50

Jimmy Choo Cinch M

Jimmy Choo Diamond Chain Earring

The North Face and Skims Partner on New Capsule

Who: The North Face and Skims

What: Capsule collection

Where: Online at skims.com starting December 10

Why: With ski season rapidly approaching, The North Face has teamed up with Skims on a new capsule collection. The pieces combine the outerwear giant’s archival styles with Skims’s signature fit and pared-back color palette. The pieces vary from ski jackets to tops and bodysuits.

Vera Wang Designs High Jewelry Collection for Jared Atelier

Who: Vera Wang and Jared Atelier

What: High jewelry collection

Where: Online at jared.com

Why: Jared has tapped none other than Vera Wang to design the third installment of Jared Atelier, the jewelry brand’s limited-edition collection. The assortment is comprised of 14 one-of-a-kind high jewelry pieces featuring natural diamonds and rubies. Ranging from $12,500 to $125,000, Wang’s chosen motifs included serpents, ribbons, and diamond strings, all inspired by nature, architecture, and modern design.

Jared Atelier x Vera Wang Ribbons Motif Diamond Cuff Bracelet

Jared Atelier x Vera Wang Diamond Strings Motif Diamond Drape Necklace

Jared Atelier x Vera Wang Serpents Motif Natural Ruby & Diamond Brooch
